@chu_chu_ezekwem I know someone in London. His rent alone is 1,800. Assuming he earns 3,500 after tax . He will be left with 1,700. From 1,700, you will deduct council tax, water bill, Energy bill, car insurance, groceries shopping, fuel. The person won’t even have 500 to save.

Council tax, energy bill, health insurance, phone and Internet bills,water,road tax, Car insurance, Rent, groceries & still Unbearable Cold.Honestly UK would drain you. Now I know that Nigeria is blessed.

@HeatherChloeDog @DrFrancesRyan Surprising. Most people who are disabled or chronically ill are able to just afford rent, council tax, water, energy, phone bills. Small amount for groceries which are getting so expensive. I’m lucky family takes me to hospital appts transport so expensive.
@JTAdeyemi Council tax. Energy. Gas. Water. Transport. Insurance. Broadband. Phone bills. Student finance & debt repayments (if you have) Unfortunately life isn’t just rent and groceries.

No Rishi Sunak, I’ll tell you what most of us are up against; Essential bills like #mortgage #rent #energy #water #counciltax #groceries #fuel … that we can’t pay.

Have you EVER, EVER received a bill that you didn’t have the means to pay? Have you? 

No! Thought not!   #r4today

In the UK, you must pay for a television license if you’re watching TV at all, even if it’s on a computer or tablet. 

The cost of the license is £159 per year for a colour television and £53.50 for black and white TV set. 

This is per home and not per person, so if you have

TV licence 44p per day
Electricity Standing Charge 53p per day
Gas standing charge 30p per day
Council Tax £5.65 per day

So you need to spend £6.92 per day BEFORE you heat your house, turn on the TV or lighting your home or putting bins out.

In the UK, you must pay for a television license if you’re watching TV at all, even if it’s on a computer or tablet. 

The cost of the license is £159 per year for a colour television and £53.50 for black and white TV set. 

This is per home and not per person, so if you have

TV licence 44p per day
Electricity Standing Charge 53p per day
Gas standing charge 30p per day
Council Tax £5.65 per day

So you need to spend £6.92 per day BEFORE you heat your house, turn on the TV or lighting your home or putting bins out.
